column4: does anyone know of a script called diskmounter that mounts my windows partition on boot and puts it on the desktop?
which brings up another question i have, for some reason my grub boot loader dissapeared and my computer auto-booted into ubuntu, does anyone know why this might happen?
it's probably just the menu is hidden
how do i bring it back up?
remove it with aptitude ;)
how do i do that?
go into aptitude, highlight the package, hit - or _ to remove all config as well.
you can also do it via the menu
w32 not win. jack-
yeah that is what i searched for
ctrl-click (or is it alt?)
it is not working for me
do you have your preferred browser setup correctly?
gnome-www-browser %s
did you update preferred-browser?
this is my entry for preferred browser gnome-www-browser %s
go to a terminal and type "gnome-www-browser" does something come up?
bash: gnome-www-browser: command not found
there's your problem ;)
try just www-browser
w3m version w3m/0.5.1, options lang=en,m17n,image,color,ansi-color,mouse,gpm,menu,cookie,ssl,ssl-verify,external-uri-loader,w3mmailer,nntp,gopher,ipv6,alarm,mark,migemo
how do i do that
sorry, no idea.  don't use a wm regularly.  Theres a command, and it'll bring up the menu to select your browser.
